snippet: The Mets said third baseman David Wright, who was removed from the World Baseball Classic, would be re-evaluated after resting for up to five days.
abstract: New York Mets third baseman David Wright is found to have a strained left intercostal muscle, putting his readiness for opening day in doubt; revelation is perhaps worst among series of injuries for the team.
lead_paragraph: The Mets said third baseman David Wright, who was removed from the World Baseball Classic, would be re-evaluated after resting for up to five days.

headline.seo: Mets’ Wright Sidelined by Intercostal Muscle Strain
headline.main: Muscle Strain Could Put Wright’s Opening Day in Doubt
headline.print_headline: Muscle Strain Could Put Wright’s Opening Day in Doubt
